alert.note: Alert for Watauga (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued November 11 at 11:45AM EST until November 11 at 3:00PM EST by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northwest North Carolina, including the following county, Watauga. * WHEN...Until 400 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is occurring, and streams continue to rise. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1138 AM EST, Doppler radar indicated moderate to heavy rainfall across the warned area. Between nearly 2 to locally 4.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Beech Mountain, Sugar Grove, Foscoe, Seven Devils, Valle Crucis, Rominger and Lovill. Portions of Watauga River Road are likely now flooded by the Watauga River.
info.instruction: In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
